intro: Xeraea boliviana, commonly known as the Bolivian xeraea, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of Bolivia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton, and is characterized by its woolly, hairy leaves. The plant produces small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool temperatures and well-drained soils. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
